      26                 :            : /**
      27                 :            :  * eProsima log layer. Logging categories and verbosities can be specified dynamically at runtime. However, even on a category 
      28                 :            :  * not covered by the current verbosity level, there is some overhead on calling a log macro. For maximum performance, you can 
      29                 :            :  * opt out of logging any particular level by defining the following symbols:
      30                 :            :  *
      31                 :            :  * * #define LOG_NO_ERROR
      32                 :            :  * * #define LOG_NO_WARNING
      33                 :            :  * * #define LOG_NO_INFO
      34                 :            :  *
      35                 :            :  * Additionally. the lowest level (Info) is disabled by default on release branches.
      36                 :            :  */
      37                 :            : 
      38                 :            : // Logging API:
      39                 :            : 
      40                 :            : //! Logs an info message. Disable it through Log::SetVerbosity, #define LOG_NO_INFO, or being in a release branch
      41                 :            : #define logInfo(cat,msg) logInfo_(cat,msg)
      42                 :            : //! Logs a warning. Disable reporting through Log::SetVerbosity or #define LOG_NO_WARNING
      43                 :            : #define logWarning(cat,msg) logWarning_(cat,msg)
      44                 :            : //! Logs an error. Disable reporting through #define LOG_NO_ERROR
      45                 :            : #define logError(cat,msg) logError_(cat,msg)
      46                 :            : 
      47                 :            : namespace eprosima {
      48                 :            : namespace fastrtps {
      49                 :            : 
      50                 :            : class LogConsumer;
      51                 :            : 
      52                 :            : /**
      53                 :            :  * Logging utilities.
      54                 :            :  * Logging is accessed through the three macros above, and configuration on the log output
      55                 :            :  * can be achieved through static methods on the class. Logging at various levels can be 
      56                 :            :  * disabled dynamically (through the Verbosity level) or statically (through the LOG_NO_[VERB]
      57                 :            :  * macros) for maximum performance.
      58                 :            :  * @ingroup COMMON_MODULE
      59                 :            :  */
      60                 :            : class Log
      61                 :            : {
      62                 :            : public:
      63                 :            :    /**
      64                 :            :     * Types of log entry.
      65                 :            :     * * Error: Maximum priority. Can only be disabled statically through #define LOG_NO_ERROR.
      66                 :            :     * * Warning: Medium priority.  Can be disabled statically and dynamically.
      67                 :            :     * * Info: Low priority. Useful for debugging. Disabled by default on release branches.
      68                 :            :     */
      69                 :            :    enum Kind {
      70                 :            :       Error,
      71                 :            :       Warning,
      72                 :            :       Info,
      73                 :            :    };
      74                 :            : 
      75                 :            :    /**
      76                 :            :     * Registers an user defined consumer to route log output. There is a default
      77                 :            :     * stdout consumer active at all times.
      78                 :            :     */
      79                 :            :    RTPS_DllAPI static void RegisterConsumer(std::unique_ptr<LogConsumer>);
      80                 :            :    //! Enables the reporting of filenames in log entries. Disabled by default.
      81                 :            :    RTPS_DllAPI static void ReportFilenames(bool);
      82                 :            :    //! Enables the reporting of function names in log entries. Enabled by default when supported.
      83                 :            :    RTPS_DllAPI static void ReportFunctions(bool);
      84                 :            :    //! Sets the verbosity level, allowing for messages equal or under that priority to be logged.
      85                 :            :    RTPS_DllAPI static void SetVerbosity(Log::Kind);
      86                 :            :    //! Returns the current verbosity level.
      87                 :            :    RTPS_DllAPI static Log::Kind GetVerbosity();
      88                 :            :    //! Sets a filter that will pattern-match against log categories, dropping any unmatched categories.
      89                 :            :    RTPS_DllAPI static void SetCategoryFilter    (const std::regex&);
      90                 :            :    //! Sets a filter that will pattern-match against filenames, dropping any unmatched categories.
      91                 :            :    RTPS_DllAPI static void SetFilenameFilter    (const std::regex&);
      92                 :            :    //! Sets a filter that will pattern-match against the provided error string, dropping any unmatched categories.
      93                 :            :    RTPS_DllAPI static void SetErrorStringFilter (const std::regex&);
      94                 :            :    //! Returns the logging engine to configuration defaults.
      95                 :            :    RTPS_DllAPI static void Reset();
      96                 :            :    //! Stops the logging thread. It will re-launch on the next call to a successful log macro.
      97                 :            :    RTPS_DllAPI static void KillThread();
      98                 :            :    // Note: In VS2013, if you're linking this class statically, you will have to call KillThread before leaving
      99                 :            :    // main, due to an unsolved MSVC bug.
     100                 :            : 
     101                 :            :    struct Context {
     102                 :            :       const char* filename;
     103                 :            :       int line;
     104                 :            :       const char* function;
     105                 :            :       const char* category;
     106                 :            :    };
     107                 :            : 
     108                 :            :    struct Entry 
     109                 :            :    {
     110                 :            :       std::string message;

     112                 :            :       Log::Kind kind;
     113                 :            :    };
     114                 :            : 
     115                 :            :    /** 
     116                 :            :     * Not recommended to call this method directly! Use the following macros:
     117                 :            :     *  * logInfo(cat, msg);
     118                 :            :     *  * logWarning(cat, msg);
     119                 :            :     *  * logError(cat, msg);
     120                 :            :     */
